Dan and Lane's place was great and was exactly as described and as pictured. It is very spacious and has everything you could possibly need for your getaway. The kitchen is fully stocked with cookware and utensils, including an electric skillet, and there is a propane grill for your cookouts. The bed in the master bedroom was very comfortable, and the wi-fi worked perfectly for my remote work during our stay, as well as to stream some TV shows at night. Dan and Lane are wonderful hosts; they are extremely kind, welcoming and hospitable. They graciously agreed to let us check in early after we drove overnight. They also allowed us to use the above-ground pool on their property, which our 22-month-old daughter loved. They were also very quick to answer any questions or assist with any issues, and they were kind enough to sit and have a conversation with us. Dan and Lane have thought of every detail in their house, including k-cups for the Keurig, bottles of water in the fridge upon our arrival, and extra toothbrushes and toothpaste should you forget yours.
The location, while rural and somewhat remote, is within easy driving distance of a couple of different Wal-Marts, and Jackson, TN, is only about 40 minutes away and has most of the major stores and fast food restaurants. The location was also very much a plus for us, as we were looking to get away from the hustle and bustle and enjoy some peace and quiet. The area around the house is very quiet, and when we went out on the deck at night, all we could hear were the crickets.
I honestly can't recommend Dan and Lane's place enough, whether you are just looking for a quiet, socially distanced getaway during COVID or looking for a place to stay for work, you really can't go wrong. We are already planning our return visit.

If you are looking to get away, enjoy some beautiful Tennessee scenery and meet a couple of kind, extraordinary hosts -- then this could be the place for you. Miss Martha's is off-the-beaten-path, but it is an easy drive on paved roads. Miss Martha's is so very comfortable and I immediately felt at home.
The hosts are extremely thoughtful & very attentive to the small details. Miss Martha's is well-stocked with coffee, bottled water & wonderful English muffins for breakfast. The home was extremely clean and ready for my arrival.
Regular communications were initiated by the hosts prior to arrival to assist in my travels and locating the home. Check-in information and assistance was provided ahead of time to accommodate easy access/check-in.
Jan, Bill & Lulu (their sweet Corgie) stopped by to welcome me to Miss Martha's and assure that I had everything needed. I shared with them that I was in the area to work on some of my family genealogy research. They were able to provide information, stories and resource suggestions. We figured out that we share some family-lines (through marriage). As a genealogist -- this was so very exciting and a highlight of my time in Tennessee.
Miss Martha's is a perfect place to find peace, rest, and quiet time. You can hear the wind blow and the many voices of the small birds that sing. There is no wi-fi, but phone service was strong (I have AT&T) -- if you have a need to connect.
At Miss Martha's you will definitely meet new friends -- and who knows -- maybe you'll even find a new family connection like me.
I highly recommend this wonderful home. I do hope to return and stay longer!
